Apple___Apple_Scab:
• Fungus overwinters on dead foliage on ground.
• Spores dispersed by wind.
• High moisture encourages fungal growth.
Apple___Black_rot: Spores can overwinter in twigs or fruit remaining on the tree and spread during rainfall.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust:
• Fungus requires two hosts to complete lifecycle.
• Forms galls on Eastern red cedar and spores are carried by wind to apple.
• Use caution when planting apple close to red cedar.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: Infection of fruit is more likely if there are rainfalls close to harvest.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_Gray_leaf_spot:
• Disease emergence is favored in areas where a corn crop is followed by more corn with no rotation.
• Prolonged periods of foggy or cloudy weather can cause severe Cercospora epidemics.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_:
• Disease is spread by wind-borne spores.
• Some of the most popularly grown sweet corn varieties have little or no resistance to the disease.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: The disease mainly spread through rain splash and wind.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): The leaf and berry symptoms may occur together in single cane or may show symptom on only one parts. The severe infestation of measles kill grapevine in a single year which is commonly called apoplexy. The symptoms are common in 5 to 7 years old vineyard. The prune wounds help in pathogen entrance and establishment.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Common in tropical and subtropical grapes. The disease appeared late in the season. Cynthiana and Cabernet Sauvignon are susceptible to this pathogen.
Grape___Black_rot:
• Disease favors rainy weather.
• Spores may ooze out during rain.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): Affected trees have stunted growth, bear multiple off-season flowers (most of which fall off), and produce small, irregularly shaped fruit with a thick, pale peel that remains green at the bottom and tastes very bitter.
Peach___Bacterial_spot:
• Periods of frequent rainfall during late bloom and early petal drop increase likelihood of fruit and leaf infection.
• Infection is rare during hot, dry weather.
Pepper_bell___Bacterial_spot: Disease emergence favored by warm, wet conditions; the pathogen can enter a field on seed and transplants and can be spread within a field by wind-driven rain, clipping plants and aerosols.
Potato___Early_blight: Disease emergence favors cycles of wet and dry conditions with periods of high humidity and leaf wetness.
Potato___Late_blight:
• The pathogen can survive for several months to years in the soil.
• Emergence of disease favored by moist, cool conditions.
• Major cause of disease spread is infected tubers.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: Disease emergence favored by dry weather and high relative humidity.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Disease emergence favored by wet foliage for extended periods of time.
Tomato___Early_blight:
• Disease can spread rapidly after plants have set fruit.
• Movement of air-borne spores and contact with infested soil are causes for the spread of the disease
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: The disease is favored by high relative humidity. Also, a common disease in green house tomato crop.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot:
• Spread by water splash.
• Fungus overwinters in plant debris.
Tomato___Target_Spot: The pathogen infects cucumber, pawpaw, ornamental plants, some weed species etc. The damaged fruits are susceptible for this disease.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot:
• Disease emergence favored by warm temperatures and wet weather.
• Symptoms are very similar to other tomato diseases but only bacterial spot will cause a cut leaf to ooze bacterial exudate.
• The disease is spread by infected seed, wind-driven rain, diseased transplants, or infested soil.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus:
• ToMV is a closely related strain of Tobacco mosaic virus (TMV), it enters fields via infected weeds, peppers or potato plants.
• The virus may also be transmitted to tomato fields by grasshoppers, small mammals and birds.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: The virus is transmitted by white flies and may cause 100 % yield loss if the plants infect at early stage of crop. The virus also infects other hosts like common bean, ornamental plants and several weed species.
Tomato___Two-spotted_spider_mite:
• Spider mites thrive in dusty conditions.
• Water-stressed plants are more susceptible to attack.
